ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 11 Magnetic Field Sensor data at 5 min Time Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The magnetic field sensor, located at a few meters away from the spacecraft was designed to provide the orthogonal components of the magnetic field: Hp was parallel to the spin axis that was held nearly parallel to the rotation axis of the Earth, He was directed toward Earth center, and Hn pointed eastward. The magnetometer had a range of ±1000 nT (without saturation) and a resolution of 0.1 nT. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA Office of Space Science Applications (United States), NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States), Howard J. Singer

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to GOES 11 Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer (MAG) Magnetic Field Data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 11 Magnetic Field Monitor data in CSV format as well as the magnetometer data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g08_magneto_1m_19950201_1995_02_28.csv, indicates GOES 8 magnetometer data at 5 min time resolution from Feb 1, 1995 to Feb 28, 1995.

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds. Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags.

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: GOES 11 Magnetic Field Vector 5 min Time Resolution Data in Spacecraft Coordinates
Parameter.Description: Magnetic field vector for GOES 11 in spacecraft coordinates in units of nT. HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the orbital plane of the spacecraft. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward for GOES 11.

Structure.Description: HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the orbital plane of the spacecraft. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward for GOES 11.
